page.title: 16The Elderly in Rye
page.content: We asked one of the organisers about activities for the old people. She told us about the day centre where the old people have tea, coffee and talk to each other. They do knitting, sewing and at 12 oclock they have a cooked lunch. The old people come not only from Rye but from surrounding villages. The oldest person there is 85, the youngest 64. It takes place in 6 rooms of the Baptist Hall every Wednesday and usually 26 people go. The money for running it is raised by other organisations in the town. The old people pay one pound each time they come. The W.R.V.S. runs a "Meals on Wheels" service and there is also a monthly lunch club. There are two sites of old people's flats in Rye.
